name: Valid Anagram

similar_questions.title: Find All Anagrams in a String
Find Resultant Array After Removing Anagrams

title: Valid Anagram
content:
Given two strings s and t, return true if t is an anagram of s, and false otherwise.

 

Example 1:

Input: s = "anagram", t = "nagaram"

Output: true

Example 2:

Input: s = "rat", t = "car"

Output: false

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= s.length, t.length <= 5 * 104
  • s and t consist of lowercase English letters.

 

Follow up: What if the inputs contain Unicode characters? How would you adapt your solution to such a case?

discussion_posts.name: 45-nobbie
discussion_posts.content:
If t is the anagram of s then by comparing both sorted strings can give the answer

If t is amagram of s then sorted t must be same as sorted s so,
"""
return sorted(s) == sorted(t)
"""

discussion_posts.name: jacksonchill
discussion_posts.content: There seems no discussion about the followup Unicode question. May I ask that is there any idea about it?\nThe question is a bit vague for me. I understand that Unicode is a binary coding method regardless of program/platform, but how can it reflect on an input string?

discussion_posts.name: enamespace
discussion_posts.content:
when i solve the problem by using array[26], i check the NO.1 solution. he solve the problem by using calculation?
i wonder whether it's math trick or it's simply a his hash function ?
i guess it's a hash function with big probability to ensure no collision so far.

discussion_posts.name: harnalerohan
discussion_posts.content: var isAnagram = (s, t) => s.split(\'\').sort().join(\'\') === t.split(\'\').sort().join(\'\') ? true : false
